questions.question: You can start your letter: ''I am writing __ your letter of...''

choices.answer: as regards
with reference to

questions.question: If you are following up after a phone call, you could write:

choices.answer: Following our telephone conversation of this morning...
Further our telephone conversation this morning...

questions.question: If someone has asked you for (e.g. a brochure) you can write in your letter:

choices.answer: As you asked for, I am enclosing a brochure...
As you requested, I am enclosing a brochure

questions.question: You are writing to all your customers to give them some important information. You start your letter:

choices.answer: Please advise that...
Please be advised that...

questions.question: If you are writing to ask for something, you could write:

choices.answer: I would appreciate for your advice
I would be grateful for your advice

questions.question: If you are asking your reader to do something, you could ask:

choices.answer: I would appreciate if you could...
I would appreciate it if you could...

questions.question: If you are including something with your letter (a brochure or a price list, for example) you can write:

choices.answer: Enclosed is...
Enclosing is...

questions.question: To refer to a future meeting, you can write:

choices.answer: I look forward to see you on (date)
I look forward to seeing you on (date)

questions.question: A standard way to end your letter is to offer help. You can write:

choices.answer: Please do not hesitate to contact me if I can be of any further assistanc
''If you would like any further help, please to contact me.''

questions.question: If you want someone to act immediately, you can write:

choices.answer: ''Please (confirm / contact me, etc) at your earliest convenience.''
''Please (confirm / contact me) immediately.''
